github.copilot.viewsWelcome.signIn.message:
Sign in with GitHub to use Copilot, your AI pair programmer.

[Sign In to GitHub.com](command:github.copilotChat.signIn)

[Sign in with a GHE.com account](command:github.copilotChat.signInGHE)

Or explore the [Copilot walkthrough](command:github.copilot.open.walkthrough) to learn more!

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.signInGHE.message:
Sign in with GitHub to use Copilot, your AI pair programmer.

[Sign In to GHE.com](command:github.copilotChat.signInGHE)

[Sign in with a GitHub.com account](command:github.copilotChat.signIn)

Or explore the [Copilot walkthrough](command:github.copilot.open.walkthrough) to learn more!

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.individual.message:
Get started with GitHub Copilot.

[Start 30-day Free Trial](https://github.com/github-copilot/signup?editor=vscode)

If you have a different account with a Copilot subscription, you can [sign in to that account](command:github.copilotChat.signInChoose?%22force%22).

Or explore the [Copilot walkthrough](command:github.copilot.open.walkthrough) to learn more!

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.individual.e:
Your Copilot subscription has expired.

[Review Copilot Settings](https://github.com/settings/copilot?editor=vscode)
github.copilot.viewsWelcome.enterprise: Contact your GitHub organization administrator to enable Copilot.

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.offline.message:
You are currently offline. Please connect to the internet to use Copilot.

[Retry Connection](command:github.copilot.offline)

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.contactSuppo.message:
There seems to be a problem with your account. Please contact GitHub support.

[Contact Support](https://support.github.com/?editor=vscode)

github.copilot.viewsWelcome.chatDisabled.message:
GitHub Copilot Chat is currently disabled for your account by an organization administrator. Contact an organization administrator to enable chat.

[Learn More](https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/managing-copilot/managing-github-copilot-in-your-organization/managing-github-copilot-features-in-your-organization/managing-policies-for-copilot-in-your-organization)

github.copilot.devcontainer.generateDevC: Generate Dev Container Configuration with Copilot
github.copilot.config.enableCodeActions: Controls if Copilot commands are shown as Code Actions when available
Controls whether Copilot generates suggestions for renaming
github.copilot.config.localeOverride: Specify a locale that Copilot should respond in, e.g. `en` or `fr`. By default, Copilot will respond using VS Code's configured display language locale.
github.copilot.config.edits.enabled: Whether to enable the Copilot Edits feature.
github.copilot.config.terminalChatLocati: Controls where chat queries from the terminal should be opened.
github.copilot.config.scopeSelection: Whether to prompt the user to select a specific symbol scope if the user uses `/explain` and the active editor has no selection.
github.copilot.config.followUps: Whether to suggest follow-up messages in the chat.
github.copilot.config.debugTerminalComma: Whether to quick fix hints in the debug terminal and the `copilot-debug` command.
A list of commands for which the "Debug Command" quick fix action should be shown in the debug terminal.
github.copilot.config.codeGeneration.ins:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
github.copilot.config.codeGeneration.use:
Controls whether code instructions from `.github/copilot-instructions.md` are added to Copilot requests.

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
github.copilot.config.codeGeneration.ins: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate code. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
github.copilot.config.testGeneration.ins:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's quality and performance.
github.copilot.config.experimental.testG: A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that generate tests. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
github.copilot.config.reviewSelection.en: Enables code review on current selection.
github.copilot.config.reviewSelection.in:
A set of instructions that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection.
Instructions can come from: 
- a file in the workspace: `{ "file": "fileName" }`
- text in natural language: `{ "text": "Use underscore for field names." }`

Note: Keep your instructions short and precise. Poor instructions can degrade Copilot's effectiveness.
A text instruction that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
A path to a file that will be added to Copilot requests that provide code review for the current selection. Optionally, you can specify a language for the instruction.
github.copilot.config.generateTests.code: Show 'Generate tests' code lens for symbols that are not covered by current test coverage information.
github.copilot.config.temporalContext.en: Whether to include recently viewed and edited files with Copilot requests. This is currently only for the inline chat feature.
github.copilot.config.inlineChatCompleti: Suggestion that triggers inline chat as soon as a line mostly consists of words.
github.copilot.config.inlineChatHint.ena: Hint for inline chat that shows once a line mostly consists of words.
github.copilot.config.startDebugging.ena: Enables the `/startDebugging` intent in panel chat. Generates or finds launch config to match the query (if any), project structure, and more.
github.copilot.config.search.semanticTex: Enables semantic search results in the search view. Disabling this setting requires reloading the window for the change to take effect.
github.copilot.config.runCommand.enabled: Enables the `/runCommand` intent in panel chat.
github.copilot.config.fixTestFailure.ena: Enables the `/fixTestFailure` intent in chat and delegates certain `/fix` invocations automatically.
github.copilot.config.setupTests.enabled: Enables the `/setupTests` intent and prompting in `/tests` generation.

copilot.vscode.api.description: Ask about VS Code extension development

copilot.vscode.search.description: Generate query parameters for workspace search
copilot.vscode.search.sampleRequest: Search for 'foo' in all files under my 'src' directory
copilot.vscode.runCommand.description: Search for and execute a command in VS Code
copilot.vscode.startDebugging.descriptio: Generate launch config and start debugging in VS Code (Experimental)
copilot.vscode.startDebugging.sampleRequ: Attach to node app at port 9229

copilot.terminal.description: Ask how to do something in the terminal
copilot.terminal.sampleRequest: How do I view all files within a directory including sub-directories?

github.copilot.config.useProjectTemplate: Use relevant GitHub projects as starter projects when using `/new`

github.copilot.command.generateConfigura.message: $(sparkle) Generate Debug Configuration with GitHub Copilot

github.copilot.walkthrough.title: GitHub Copilot
github.copilot.walkthrough.description: Your AI pair programmer to write code faster and smarter
github.copilot.walkthrough.signIn.title: Sign in with GitHub
github.copilot.walkthrough.signIn.descri:
To get started with Copilot, sign in with your GitHub account.
Double-check you're using the right GitHub account. You can also sign in later using the account menu.
 
[Sign In](command:github.copilot.signIn)
Sign in to GitHub via this walkthrough or VS Code's account menu
Copilot suggests lines of code **as you type** and multiple lines for **function signatures**.
  
**Prompts in comments** make suggestions specific to your desired outcome, logic and steps.
  
[Getting started videos](https://github.com/features/copilot/getting-started?utm_source=editor&utm_medium=walkthrough&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-videolandingpage)
github.copilot.walkthrough.panelChat.des:
In the **Chat Panel**, talk to Copilot about general programming questions or about your current code using **@workspace**. Type ``@`` to view all available chat participants, each with their own specific expertise to assist you.
[Chat with Copilot](command:workbench.action.chat.open)
github.copilot.walkthrough.panelChat.med: Copilot Chat view in the sidebar
github.copilot.walkthrough.inlineChatNot: **Inline Chat** enables you to iteratively generate edits and get answers to quick questions, directly on your code. Use **`ctrl + i`** to open inline chat in your active code editor.
Copilot Chat view in the inline widget
github.copilot.walkthrough.inlineChatMac: **Inline Chat** enables you to iteratively generate edits and get answers to quick questions, directly on your code. Use **`cmd + i`** to open inline chat in your active code editor.
Copilot Chat view in the inline widget
github.copilot.walkthrough.iterate.title: You are in control
github.copilot.walkthrough.iterate.descr:
Just as you would review a colleague's code, you should always assess, analyze, and validate AI-generated code.
  
If the first suggestion doesn't work, Copilot can generate more options. You can edit the Copilot settings and keyboard shortcuts to personalize your experience.
  
[Edit keyboard shortcuts](command:workbench.action.openGlobalKeybindings?%5B%22copilot%22%5D)
  
[Personalize settings](command:workbench.action.openSettings?%5B%22copilot%22%5D)
github.copilot.walkthrough.iterate.media: An editor with a toolbar widget overlay showing arrows for navigating multiple suggestions from Copilot
github.copilot.walkthrough.creativity.de:
Pair up with AI to outline your idea in a comment, then generate the implementation, and then test suites. Or, work backwards from example output!
Copilot will keep surprising you as you challenge it.
  
[Prompts, tips, and use cases](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/prompt-crafting)
github.copilot.walkthrough.creativity.me: Metrics showing how much Copilot increases productivity for developers. The metrics read: 74% focus on more satisfying work. 88% feel more productive. 96% are faster with more repetitive tasks.
